result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Cyrena Mccall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3/9/17 - Sentencing Hearing

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 10:01am
INCLUDES 14CM1378, 15CF1132, 15CM420
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears in person with Atty John Wallace.
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

Parties have received PSI reports
Atty Wallace did make one correction to PSI regarding drug testing through ATTIC for day report
L.B. makes statement to court
State makes argument
Atty Wallace makes argument
Defendant makes statement
P.B. makes statement to court
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 15CF1132 Ct. 2 Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), PTAC: 8 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 5 years ES. Deft is eligible for Substance Abuse Programming but NOT Challenge Incarceration Programming. 15CF1132 Ct. 4 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer: 9 months jail. 15CM420 Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer: 9 months jail. All sentences to run concurrent to each other. Credit granted of 189 days towards all sentences. CONDITIONS of ES: Deft will be supervised in accordance with DOC policy, in addition to conditions of her court order. Deft to be supervised at the level based on the DOC evaluation. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by DOC. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC and other court obligations and supervision fees. Submission of DNA sample, or provide proof of prior submission, and pay any surcharges. 

Deft is remanded to Marathon County Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Prison

to ADA Mayo & Atty Bachman with PSI

Interfaced to DOC

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:15am
INCLUDES 15CF1132, 14CM1378, 15CM420
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace
Date and time set for motion filed by defense for bond reduction and letter written by defendant on health status

Atty Wallace makes statement regarding medical condition of deft and asks court to modify to signature bond
State does not have stance on bond reduction due to medical condition of defendant deteriorating
Deft states she signed a release form at jail last week for medical records to be provided to court
COURT grants motion to modify bond
COURT ORDERS: Deft to provide proof of medical documentation of COPD and conjestive heart failure by close of business day on 07/15/16
COURT ORDERS: Converts Cash bond to signature bond of $50,000 to cover all three files. CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety from drug and alcohol, may take prescription medication and only take as prescriped. Report to ATTIC for Day report for drug and alcohol testing. No contact with co-defendant- H.F. In 14CF1378- No contact with Walmart. 

Adj: 9:26am

AMENDED.  Includes 15CF1132, 14CM1378 and 15CM420.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-Day report for drug/alcohol testing.   No contact with  H.F., P.B., & Walmart Store. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and only in the amount prescibed.  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  DEFT TO PROVIDE PROOF OF MEDICAL DOCUMENTATION OF COPD AND CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE BY CLOSE OF BUSINESS DAY ON 7/15/16.
